required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fixed Bearing Versus Mobile Bearing Patient Satisfaction and Clinical Outcome Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective, Consecutive Series, Single Surgeon Study Comparing Patient Satisfaction and Clinical Outcomes in Patients With Fixed Bearing Versus Mobile Bearing Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if there is a patient satisfaction preference of Fixed Bearing versus Mobile Bearing Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty (UKA) in patients who are at a minimum two years post operative. Patient reported outcomes and expectations will be analyzed along with all retrospective chart data in patient with a Fixed Bearing or a Mobile Bearing UKA in one or both knees.

primary_outcome.measure: To compare patient satisfaction scores of the Unicompartmental Fixed Bearing (FB) UKA vs Unicompartmental Mobile Bearing (MB) UKA
primary_outcome.description: Utilizing Knee Score Society survey sub-score

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS)
secondary_outcome.description: Knee symptoms, pain, function and Qol
Knee Function-patients ability to forget the artificial joint in everyday life

secondary_outcome.measure: Euro-Qual Health related Quality of Life

secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire for work history prior to surgery and after surgery

Radiographic analysis will include evaluation of component and limb alignment, evidence of component subsidence or migration, and the presence and progression of radiolucent lines between the prosthesis, bone and cement.

other_outcome.description: Full Knee Society Score (KSS) and Short Form Health Survey SF-12

other_outcome.measure: Sub Study 2: Prosthesis positing versus outcomes analysis
other_outcome.description: CT scan of Fixed Bearing patients for implant position

arm_group.arm_group_label: Fixed Bearing or Mobile Bearing UKA

intervention.intervention_name: Fixed Bearing or Mobile Bearing UKA
intervention.description: Fixed Bearing or Mobile Bearing UKA Patients who have undergone a primary Fixed Bearing or a Mobile Bearing UKA in either knee and are at a minimum 2 years post-op.
intervention.arm_group_label: Fixed Bearing or Mobile Bearing UKA
intervention.other_name: Zimmer Unicompartmental High Flex Knee System or Oxford Mobile Bearing

study_pop.textblock: Patients that have undergone a Unicompartment Knee Replacement with a Fixed Bearing or Mobile Bearing prosthesis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Must be able to read, understand and provide written informed consent on the Institutional Review Board (IRB) approved Informed Consent Form (ICF)
2. Ability to understand and provide written authorization for use and disclosure of personal health information.
3. Subject who are able and willing to comply with the study protocol and follow-up visit.
4. Must be 18 years or older to participate.
5. Subjects must have a clinically documented Osteoarthritis in a knee, single or multiple compartments,
6. Subjects must have undergone a FB UKA or MB UKA in one and or both knees. MB UKA or FB UKA patients revised to Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA) are eligible to enroll.
7. Must be a minimum 2 year (24 months) post-surgery on the knee.
8. The UKA operation must have been performed by the Investigator.
9. Subjects must be able to return for the follow-up appointment, and have the mental capacity to cooperate with PRO's, questionnaires, physical exam and imaging studies.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects with Bicompartmental UKA (i.e. medical or lateral UKA combined with Patello Femoral Joint (PFJ) (UKA)
2. Women who are pregnant.
